DOC.brief_summary: The investigators sought to discover which one of the following strategies is the safest for patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention: paclitaxel-coated balloon+Genous stent; Genous stent; drug eluting stent (paclitaxel).
DOC.brief_title: To Achieve an Early Reendothelialization at the Expense of Low Restenosis: The EREMUS Study
DOC.criteria: Stable or unstable angina pectoris suitable to PCI of at least one coronary vessel Age >18 years Recent (<72 hours) acute myocardial infarction Creatinine clearance <40 ml/min Allergy or hypersensitivity to at least two between: aspirin, clopidogrel, heparin, bivalirudin, paclitaxel, contrast media Life expectancy <1 year
